name: hbcd_qmri_postproc
author: Erik G. Lee
description: qMRI Post Proc takes T1/T2/PDmaps and synthetic T1w/T2w images generated through the HBCD SyMRI workflow (outside of CBRAIN) and uses these to create other images and imaging derived phenotypes of interest based on the high resolution anatomical data and bibsnet segmentations.

inputs.description: The study-wide BIDS directory. In CBRAIN this is also referred to (and used) as the subject directory since a new BIDS dir will be made for the selected subject prior to processing.
inputs.name: Subject Directory

inputs.description: The name of the output directory to store outcomes of preprocessing. When processing is ran via CBRAIN only subject-specific files/folders will be saved, so the naming of the output folder will not influence the final naming/destination of files/folders.
inputs.name: Output Directory

inputs.description: The study-wide qMRI directory (can be from SyMRI or other pipeline). In CBRAIN this is also referred to (and used) as the subject directory since a new BIDS dir will be made for the selected subject prior to processing.
inputs.name: qMRI Directory

inputs.description: The study-wide BIBSNET/CABINET directory. In CBRAIN this is also referred to (and used) as the subject directory since a new BIDS dir will be made for the selected subject prior to processing.
inputs.name: BIBSNET Directory

inputs.description: Space delimited list of subjects to be processed (with or without sub- prefix)
inputs.name: Participant Label

inputs.description: select a specific session to be processed (with or without ses- prefix)
inputs.name: Session Label

inputs.description: JSON file with custom grouping of regions to tabulate results for.
inputs.name: Region Groupings JSON

inputs.description: The the key for the key/value pair to try and grab sequence name from. For example if the qMRI file is named sub-1_acq-QALAS.nii.gz, this should be acq. If the sequence is found, it will be represented as quant in the output files.
inputs.name: Sequence Name Source
derivatives_prefix
inputs.description: Folders to put before the pipeline specific folder. By default this will look like DataProvider/derivatives/PipelineName, where pipeline name is specific to the current pipeline. The provided string must end in /

output-files.name: Output Directory
output-files.description: The output directory to store outcomes of preprocessing and reports
